instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> burned <TRANSISTOR>Q7100</TRANSISTOR>
threads.message:
No signs of water damage at all.

<TRANSISTOR>Q7100</TRANSISTOR> burned and ruined the traces under it, so after scraping away the damage and making sure nothing was shorted, i soldered a new one upside-down stuck to L7100, and the fan spins!, until the new <TRANSISTOR>Q7100</TRANSISTOR> gets hot enough to melt the solder on it within a few seconds, ruining <TRANSISTOR>Q7100</TRANSISTOR> and it gets stuck open, and did the same thing with another.

the rail it is switching has a 0.003 drop to ground, witch i figured was normal since it is low voltage cpu rail, I'm thinking the cpu is bad, and will simply kill any <TRANSISTOR>Q7100</TRANSISTOR> i put there.

looking for any input, because it sounds like a rabbit hole to me.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> burned <TRANSISTOR>Q7100</TRANSISTOR>
threads.message: <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> is bad for sure and 0.003 to GND is too low. Remove <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7100</TRANSISTOR> and check resistance again. I'm afraid your CPU is also fried. <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7100</TRANSISTOR> are certainly dead again replace only as a pair.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> burned <TRANSISTOR>Q7100</TRANSISTOR>
threads.message:
forgot to mention, i did replace them as a pair, and the resistance does not change when i remove them both

i figured the cpu was bad, just wanted some kind of confirmation before i waste more time on it, thanks.
